ARABIC_TEXT: هَلۡ أَتَىٰ عَلَى ٱلۡإِنسَٰنِ حِينٞ مِّنَ ٱلدَّهۡرِ لَمۡ يَكُن شَيۡـٔٗا مَّذۡكُورًا
TRANSLATION: (1) Has there [not] come upon man a period of time when he was not a thing [even] mentioned?

ARABIC_TEXT: إِنَّا خَلَقۡنَا ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ مِن نُّطۡفَةٍ أَمۡشَاجٖ نَّبۡتَلِيهِ فَجَعَلۡنَٰهُ سَمِيعَۢا بَصِيرًا
TRANSLATION: (2) Indeed, We created man from a sperm-drop mixture[1811] that We may try him; and We made him hearing and seeing.
FOOTNOTES: [1811]- i.e., a combination of the male and female substance, within the womb.

ARABIC_TEXT: إِنَّا هَدَيۡنَٰهُ ٱلسَّبِيلَ إِمَّا شَاكِرٗا وَإِمَّا كَفُورًا
TRANSLATION: (3) Indeed, We guided him to the way, be he grateful or be he ungrateful.

ARABIC_TEXT: إِنَّآ أَعۡتَدۡنَا لِلۡكَٰفِرِينَ سَلَٰسِلَاْ وَأَغۡلَٰلٗا وَسَعِيرًا
TRANSLATION: (4) Indeed, We have prepared for the disbelievers chains and shackles and a blaze.

ARABIC_TEXT: إِنَّ ٱلۡأَبۡرَارَ يَشۡرَبُونَ مِن كَأۡسٖ كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا كَافُورًا
TRANSLATION: (5) Indeed, the righteous will drink from a cup [of wine] whose mixture is of Kāfūr,[1812]

ARABIC_TEXT: عَيۡنٗا يَشۡرَبُ بِهَا عِبَادُ ٱللَّهِ يُفَجِّرُونَهَا تَفۡجِيرٗا
TRANSLATION: (6) A spring of which the [righteous] servants of Allāh will drink; they will make it gush forth in force [and abundance].

ARABIC_TEXT: يُوفُونَ بِٱلنَّذۡرِ وَيَخَافُونَ يَوۡمٗا كَانَ شَرُّهُۥ مُسۡتَطِيرٗا
TRANSLATION: (7) They [are those who] fulfill [their] vows and fear a Day whose evil will be widespread.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَيُطۡعِمُونَ ٱلطَّعَامَ عَلَىٰ حُبِّهِۦ مِسۡكِينٗا وَيَتِيمٗا وَأَسِيرًا
TRANSLATION: (8) And they give food in spite of love for it[1813] to the needy, the orphan, and the captive,
FOOTNOTES: [1813]- The meaning here may also be "out of love for Him," i.e., Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā).

ARABIC_TEXT: إِنَّمَا نُطۡعِمُكُمۡ لِوَجۡهِ ٱللَّهِ لَا نُرِيدُ مِنكُمۡ جَزَآءٗ وَلَا شُكُورًا
TRANSLATION: (9) [Saying], "We feed you only for the face [i.e., approval] of Allāh. We wish not from you reward or gratitude.

ARABIC_TEXT: إِنَّا نَخَافُ مِن رَّبِّنَا يَوۡمًا عَبُوسٗا قَمۡطَرِيرٗا
TRANSLATION: (10) Indeed, We fear from our Lord a Day austere and distressful."

ARABIC_TEXT: فَوَقَىٰهُمُ ٱللَّهُ شَرَّ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلۡيَوۡمِ وَلَقَّىٰهُمۡ نَضۡرَةٗ وَسُرُورٗا
TRANSLATION: (11) So Allāh will protect them from the evil of that Day and give them radiance and happiness

ARABIC_TEXT: وَجَزَىٰهُم بِمَا صَبَرُواْ جَنَّةٗ وَحَرِيرٗا
TRANSLATION: (12) And will reward them for what they patiently endured [with] a garden [in Paradise] and silk [garments].

ARABIC_TEXT: مُّتَّكِـِٔينَ فِيهَا عَلَى ٱلۡأَرَآئِكِۖ لَا يَرَوۡنَ فِيهَا شَمۡسٗا وَلَا زَمۡهَرِيرٗا
TRANSLATION: (13) [They will be] reclining therein on adorned couches. They will not see therein any [burning] sun or [freezing] cold.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَدَانِيَةً عَلَيۡهِمۡ ظِلَٰلُهَا وَذُلِّلَتۡ قُطُوفُهَا تَذۡلِيلٗا
TRANSLATION: (14) And near above them are its shades, and its [fruit] to be picked will be lowered in compliance.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَيُطَافُ عَلَيۡهِم بِـَٔانِيَةٖ مِّن فِضَّةٖ وَأَكۡوَابٖ كَانَتۡ قَوَارِيرَا۠
TRANSLATION: (15) And there will be circulated among them vessels of silver and cups having been [created] clear [as glass],

ARABIC_TEXT: قَوَارِيرَاْ مِن فِضَّةٖ قَدَّرُوهَا تَقۡدِيرٗا
TRANSLATION: (16) Clear glasses [made] from silver of which they have determined the measure.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَيُسۡقَوۡنَ فِيهَا كَأۡسٗا كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا زَنجَبِيلًا
TRANSLATION: (17) And they will be given to drink a cup [of wine] whose mixture is of ginger

ARABIC_TEXT: عَيۡنٗا فِيهَا تُسَمَّىٰ سَلۡسَبِيلٗا
TRANSLATION: (18) [From] a fountain within it [i.e., Paradise] named Salsabeel.

ARABIC_TEXT: ۞ وَيَطُوفُ عَلَيۡهِمۡ وِلۡدَٰنٞ مُّخَلَّدُونَ إِذَا رَأَيۡتَهُمۡ حَسِبۡتَهُمۡ لُؤۡلُؤٗا مَّنثُورٗا
TRANSLATION: (19) There will circulate among them young boys made eternal. When you see them, you would think them [as beautiful as] scattered pearls.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَإِذَا رَأَيۡتَ ثَمَّ رَأَيۡتَ نَعِيمٗا وَمُلۡكٗا كَبِيرًا
TRANSLATION: (20) And when you look there [in Paradise], you will see pleasure and great dominion.

ARABIC_TEXT: عَٰلِيَهُمۡ ثِيَابُ سُندُسٍ خُضۡرٞ وَإِسۡتَبۡرَقٞۖ وَحُلُّوٓاْ أَسَاوِرَ مِن فِضَّةٖ وَسَقَىٰهُمۡ رَبُّهُمۡ شَرَابٗا طَهُورًا
TRANSLATION: (21) Upon them [i.e., the inhabitants] will be green garments of fine silk and brocade. And they will be adorned with bracelets of silver, and their Lord will give them a purifying drink.

ARABIC_TEXT: إِنَّ هَٰذَا كَانَ لَكُمۡ جَزَآءٗ وَكَانَ سَعۡيُكُم مَّشۡكُورًا
TRANSLATION: (22) [And it will be said], "Indeed, this is for you a reward, and your effort has been appreciated."

ARABIC_TEXT: إِنَّا نَحۡنُ نَزَّلۡنَا عَلَيۡكَ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ تَنزِيلٗا
TRANSLATION: (23) Indeed, it is We who have sent down to you, [O Muḥammad], the Qur’ān progressively.

ARABIC_TEXT: فَٱصۡبِرۡ لِحُكۡمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تُطِعۡ مِنۡهُمۡ ءَاثِمًا أَوۡ كَفُورٗا
TRANSLATION: (24) So be patient for the decision of your Lord and do not obey from among them a sinner or ungrateful [disbeliever].

ARABIC_TEXT: وَٱذۡكُرِ ٱسۡمَ رَبِّكَ بُكۡرَةٗ وَأَصِيلٗا
TRANSLATION: (25) And mention the name of your Lord [in prayer] morning and evening

ARABIC_TEXT: وَمِنَ ٱلَّيۡلِ فَٱسۡجُدۡ لَهُۥ وَسَبِّحۡهُ لَيۡلٗا طَوِيلًا
TRANSLATION: (26) And during the night prostrate to Him and exalt [i.e., praise] Him a long [part of the] night.

ARABIC_TEXT: إِنَّ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ يُحِبُّونَ ٱلۡعَاجِلَةَ وَيَذَرُونَ وَرَآءَهُمۡ يَوۡمٗا ثَقِيلٗا
TRANSLATION: (27) Indeed, these [disbelievers] love the immediate and leave behind them[1814] a grave Day.
FOOTNOTES: [1814]- i.e., neglect.  The meaning may also be "leave ahead of them."

ARABIC_TEXT: نَّحۡنُ خَلَقۡنَٰهُمۡ وَشَدَدۡنَآ أَسۡرَهُمۡۖ وَإِذَا شِئۡنَا بَدَّلۡنَآ أَمۡثَٰلَهُمۡ تَبۡدِيلًا
TRANSLATION: (28) We have created them and strengthened their forms, and when We will, We can change their likenesses with [complete] alteration.

ARABIC_TEXT: إِنَّ هَٰذِهِۦ تَذۡكِرَةٞۖ فَمَن شَآءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ سَبِيلٗا
TRANSLATION: (29) Indeed, this is a reminder, so he who wills may take to his Lord a way.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَمَا تَشَآءُونَ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ كَانَ عَلِيمًا حَكِيمٗا
TRANSLATION: (30) And you do not will except that Allāh wills. Indeed, Allāh is ever Knowing and Wise.

ARABIC_TEXT: يُدۡخِلُ مَن يَشَآءُ فِي رَحۡمَتِهِۦۚ وَٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ أَعَدَّ لَهُمۡ عَذَابًا أَلِيمَۢا
TRANSLATION: (31) He admits whom He wills into His mercy; but the wrongdoers - He has prepared for them a painful punishment.
